alert.note: Alert for Brown; Jackson; Nemaha (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 22 at 7:58AM CST until February 23 at 11:00AM CST by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM CST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Areas of freezing drizzle this morning. Very cold wind chills expected tonight and Wednesday morning. Wind chills from 15 below zero to as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Kansas. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 8 AM CST this morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 8 PM this evening to 11 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Freezing drizzle will lead to slick roadways, especially bridges and overpasses. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Although the freezing drizzle should end early this morning, roadways may remain slick after it ends.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors, make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
